abstract: Officials lock down more than half the inmates at New York City's Rikers Island prison for 34 consecutive hours as part of push to curb surging gang violence at facility; unusual measure indicates difficulty officials face in reforming jail despite extensive commitment from administration of Mayor Bill de Blasio.

byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and MICHAEL WINERIP

lead_paragraph: The lockdown, which confined more than half the inmates at the Rikers Island jail complex to their cells, was an effort to curb growing gang violence.

headline.main: Seeking Drugs and Weapons, Rikers Locks Down Inmates for 34 Hours
headline.print_headline: Rikers Has a Lockdown for 34 Hours to Curb Fights
